intro: Palicourea nigrescens, commonly known as black palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Palicourea nigrescens is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
